model

Class Sound

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Sound

  • public class Sound
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents sounds that can be played. The sounds are stored in sound files on the disk, but get loaded into memory automatically.
    Author:
    jeff

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sound

        public Sound(java.lang.String soundName)
        Creates a new sound from a sound file on disk. The sound file must be present in the sounds directory.
        Parameters:
        soundName - The base of the file name from which to create the sound.

      • Sound

        public Sound(java.lang.String soundName,
     java.io.File soundFile)
        Creates a new sound from a sound file. The file can be located anywhere on disk.
        Parameters:
        soundName - What to call the sound.
        soundFile - The file that refers to the sound file on disk.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllSoundFileNames

        public static java.lang.String[] getAllSoundFileNames()
        Returns:
        Array of all sound files that were found in the sound directory.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        The name of this sound instance.

      • play

        public void play()
        Plays the sound. Make sure your speakers are turned up.

      • scanSoundDir

        public static void scanSoundDir()
        Scans the default sound directory for sound files.

      • scanSoundDir

        public static void scanSoundDir(java.lang.String dirName)
        Scans the specified sound directory for sound files.
        Parameters:
        dirName -
